docs.name: MaterialInputComponent
docs.comment:
material-input is a single- or multi-line text field where user can enter input. It can optionally have a label. NOTE: Clients must declare materialInputDirectives in their directives list instead of MaterialInputComponent.

Attributes:

  • type -- The type of the input. Defaults to "text". Other supported values are "email", "password", "url", "number", "tel", and "search". (Inputs of type "number" also use materialNumberInputDirectives)
  • multiple -- Whether the user can enter multiple values, separated by commas. This attribute only applies when type = "email", otherwise it is ignored.
  • role -- The role attribute for the input element.

inputs.name: characterCounter
inputs.comment:
A custom character counter function.

Takes in the input text; returns how many characters the text should be considered as.

inputs.name: disabled
inputs.comment: Whether or not this input is disabled (readonly input.)

inputs.name: displayBottomPanel
inputs.comment: Whether to display error, hint text, and character counter panel.

inputs.name: error
inputs.comment:
Error to be displayed.

Higher precendent than all other errors which may be on this input.

inputs.name: errorMsg
inputs.comment: The error msg to be shown on the input if it has more than maxCount characters.

inputs.name: errorRenderer
inputs.comment:
A function which takes in an error map, and returns another map, replacing errors with human readable text.

WARNING: The API of this mechanism is still in flux and there will be breaking changes. Be careful relying on it.

inputs.name: floatingLabel
inputs.comment:
Whether or not the label "floats".

If false, the label disappears when text is entered into the box. If true, it instead "floats" up above the input.

inputs.name: hintText
inputs.comment:
The hint to be shown on the input.

This text will not be displayed if there is an error message on the input.

inputs.name: inputAriaActivedescendent
inputs.comment: The ID of an element which should be assigned to the inner input element's aria-activedescendant attribute.

inputs.name: inputAriaAutocomplete
inputs.comment:
The autocomplete method applied to the inner input element.

This can be used in conjunction with inputRole values of "combobox" or "textbox". If this is "list" or "both", inputAriaHasPopup should be set to "true".

inputs.name: inputAriaControls
inputs.comment: The ID of an element which should be assigned to the inner input element's aria-controls attribute.

inputs.name: inputAriaDescribedBy
inputs.comment: The ID of an element which should be assigned to the inner input element's aria-describedby attribute.

inputs.name: inputAriaExpanded
inputs.comment: Whether or not the expandable element referred to by inputAriaOwns is currently visible.

inputs.name: inputAriaHasPopup
inputs.comment:
The value for the input element's aria-haspopup attribute, indicating that the element referred to by inputAriaOwns is expandable.

If the element referred to by inputAriaOwns is expandable, this should be either "true" or the role of the owned element.

inputs.name: inputAriaLabel
inputs.comment:
The label to be used for assistive technologies.

Use label instead of this when a visible label is desired.

inputs.name: inputAriaOwns
inputs.comment: The ID of an element which should be assigned to the inner input element's aria-owns attribute.

inputs.name: inputAutocomplete
inputs.comment:
The autocomplete attribute for the inner input element.

Defines the type of autocomplete functionality for the input. For example, can be on or `off``.

Note: Setting this field may depend on the browser implementation and is not guaranteed to turn off the autocomplete functionality.

inputs.name: label
inputs.comment:
The label for this input.

This is the default text that shows up if nothing's entered into the text box. It disappears when user inputs text.

inputs.name: leadingGlyph
inputs.comment: Any symbol to show at the leading edge of the input -- e.g. a URL link icon or similar.

inputs.name: leadingGlyphAriaLabel
inputs.comment: Aria label used for the leading glyph.

inputs.name: leadingText
inputs.comment: Any text to show at the leading edge of the input -- e.g. a currency symbol or similar.

inputs.name: maxCount
inputs.comment:
Maximum allowed characters for character counting input box.

Character count always is displayed when the value is non-null.

inputs.name: required
inputs.comment:
Whether or not the input is required.

If there's no input text, a required input will show a validation error when it's first blured.

inputs.name: requiredErrorMsg
inputs.comment: Custom error message to show when the field is required and blank.

inputs.name: rightAlign
inputs.comment:
Whether the input contents should be always right aligned.

Default value is false.

inputs.name: role
inputs.comment:
The role to assign to the inner input element.

For example, "textbox", "checkbox" and etc.

inputs.name: showCharacterCount
inputs.comment: Display character count even if maxCount is null.

inputs.name: showHintOnlyOnFocus
inputs.comment:
Whether or not the hint text will be displayed when the input is not focused.

Defaults to false.

inputs.name: trailingGlyph
inputs.comment: Any symbol to show at the trailing edge of the input -- e.g. a URL link icon or similar.

inputs.name: trailingGlyphAriaLabel
inputs.comment: Aria label used for the trailing glyph.

inputs.name: trailingText
inputs.comment: Any text to show at the trailing edge of the input -- e.g. a currency symbol or similar.

outputs.name: onBlur
outputs.comment: Publishes events when a blur event is fired.

outputs.name: onChange
outputs.comment: Publishes events when a change event is fired. (On enter, or on blur.)

outputs.name: onFocus
outputs.comment: Event when the element is focused.

outputs.name: onKeypress
outputs.comment: Publishes events whenever input text changes (each keypress).

docs.name: MaterialMultilineInputComponent
docs.comment: material-input is a multi-line text field where user can enter input, and can optionally have a label.

inputs.name: characterCounter
inputs.comment:
A custom character counter function.

Takes in the input text; returns how many characters the text should be considered as.

inputs.name: disabled
inputs.comment: Whether or not this input is disabled (readonly input.)

inputs.name: displayBottomPanel
inputs.comment: Whether to display error, hint text, and character counter panel.

inputs.name: error
inputs.comment:
Error to be displayed.

Higher precendent than all other errors which may be on this input.

inputs.name: errorMsg
inputs.comment: The error msg to be shown on the input if it has more than maxCount characters.

inputs.name: errorRenderer
inputs.comment:
A function which takes in an error map, and returns another map, replacing errors with human readable text.

WARNING: The API of this mechanism is still in flux and there will be breaking changes. Be careful relying on it.

inputs.name: floatingLabel
inputs.comment:
Whether or not the label "floats".

If false, the label disappears when text is entered into the box. If true, it instead "floats" up above the input.

inputs.name: hintText
inputs.comment:
The hint to be shown on the input.

This text will not be displayed if there is an error message on the input.

inputs.name: inputAriaDescribedBy
inputs.comment: The ID of an element which should be assigned to the inner input element's aria-describedby attribute.

inputs.name: inputAriaLabel
inputs.comment:
The label to be used for assistive technologies.

Use label instead of this when a visible label is desired.

inputs.name: inputAutocomplete
inputs.comment:
The autocomplete attribute for the inner input element.

Defines the type of autocomplete functionality for the input. For example, can be on or `off``.

Note: Setting this field may depend on the browser implementation and is not guaranteed to turn off the autocomplete functionality.

inputs.name: label
inputs.comment:
The label for this input.

This is the default text that shows up if nothing's entered into the text box. It disappears when user inputs text.

inputs.name: maxCount
inputs.comment:
Maximum allowed characters for character counting input box.

Character count always is displayed when the value is non-null.

inputs.name: maxRows
inputs.comment:
Maximum number of lines to display.

Anything more than the maxRows will cause the input to scroll.

inputs.name: required
inputs.comment:
Whether or not the input is required.

If there's no input text, a required input will show a validation error when it's first blured.

inputs.name: requiredErrorMsg
inputs.comment: Custom error message to show when the field is required and blank.

inputs.name: rows
inputs.comment:
How many rows the multiline input should have.

Can either be an integer, or a string.

inputs.name: showCharacterCount
inputs.comment: Display character count even if maxCount is null.

inputs.name: showHintOnlyOnFocus
inputs.comment:
Whether or not the hint text will be displayed when the input is not focused.

Defaults to false.

outputs.name: onBlur
outputs.comment: Publishes events when a blur event is fired.

outputs.name: onChange
outputs.comment: Publishes events when a change event is fired. (On enter, or on blur.)

outputs.name: onFocus
outputs.comment: Event when the element is focused.

outputs.name: onKeypress
outputs.comment: Publishes events whenever input text changes (each keypress).

docs.name: material_auto_suggest_input
docs.contents:
Overview

Most selection widgets care about two data points: what is selectable and what is selected.

In ACX selection widgets, what is selectable is represented by the SelectionOptions interface, while what is selected is represented by the SelectionModel interface.

Material Auto Suggest Input is an input field which provides suggestions to auto-complete the input as the user types. It uses these two interfaces via the selectionOptions and selection inputs, but additionally it has inputText which presents the text the user has entered.

Which input combinations to use for Material Auto Suggest Input depends on your use case.

If you are using the component to accept user entered content, and the list of options is used to assist content entry, you want to use selectionOptions and inputText. Together with the inputTextChange output, you can setup two-way binding for the input text.

HTML:

<material-auto-suggest-input
    [selectionOptions]="myOptions"
    [(inputText)]="myInput"
    ...>
</material-auto-suggest-input>

Dart:

class MyView {
  final myOptions = ['Foo', 'Bar', 'Baz'];
  String myInput = 'Bar';
}

If you are using the component to select one or more items from a list of options, and the input is used for filtering, you want to use selectionOptions and selection. Together with the selectionChange output, you can setup two-way binding for the selected value.

HTML:

<material-auto-suggest-input
    [selectionOptions]="myOptions"
    [(selection)]="mySelection"
    ...>
</material-auto-suggest-input>

Dart:

class MyView {
  final myOptions = [1, 2, 3];
  int mySelection = 2;
}

The selectionOptions input

The selectionOptions input accepts either a SelectionOptions class or a generic List.

If a List is passed, a StringSelectionOptions will be created with the list and the ItemRenderer if specified to support basic filtering.

If you need more advanced features, like grouped options, custom filtering or async search, you could also pass an implementation of SelectionOptions.

The selection input & output

The selection input accepts either a SelectionModel, a selected value or null.

By default Material Auto Suggest Input uses SingleSelectionModel. If a selected value is passed to the selection input, this value will be selected by the default selection model. If a null value is passed to the input, the default selection model will clear the selection.

If you need to use a MultiSelectionModel or a custom implementation of SelectionModel, you could also use the same input.

The selectionChange output emits the selected value(s) whenever selection changes. For single select, it will either be the selected value or null. For multi select, it will a list of selected values or an empty list.

For simpler single select use cases, you can use the [(selection)] syntax to setup two-way binding for your selected value.

docs.name: MaterialAutoSuggestInputComponent
docs.comment: See material_auto_suggest_input.md for an overview of the component. See examples for usage.

inputs.name: accessibleItemActivation
inputs.comment:
Whether suggestions should be smartly activated / highlighted.

Defaults to true.

When true:

  • If selection has selected values, the first selected value in options is activated / highlighted when the suggestions list opens. Justification - "If one or more options are selected before the listbox receives focus, focus is set on the first option in the list that is selected". https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices/#Listbox

  • If selection is empty, the first value in options is activated / highlighted when the suggestions list opens. Justification - "If none of the options are selected before the listbox receives focus, focus is set on the first option...". https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices/#Listbox

  • If selection is a MultiSelectionModel, deactivate any active suggestions when the search text changes. This does not apply for any text changes caused by shouldClearInputOnSelection or when the suggestions list opens. Justification - The W3 listbox spec (see above for link) says that "changes the selection state of the focused option" for multi-select listboxes. This means that a user cannot type a space into the textbox with an option focused, the space would be captured and used to toggle selection instead of typing a space. Clearing "focus" (deactivating) on any option makes it easy for the user to type a space into the textbox.

When false:

  • if selection isSingleSelect, don't auto activate / highlight any options.

  • if selection isMultiSelect, activate / highlight the first value when the suggestions list opens. Also, do not clear the active item when the search text changes.

inputs.name: ariaLabel
inputs.comment:
The label to use for assistive technology.

If not provided, uses the label instead.

inputs.name: characterCounter
inputs.comment:
A custom character counter function.

Takes in the input text; returns how many characters the text should be considered as.

inputs.name: clearIconTooltip
inputs.comment: Tooltip shown on clear icon.

inputs.name: closeOnActivate
inputs.comment:
Whether to cause dropdown to be closed on activation.

Defaults to true.

inputs.name: closeOnEnter
inputs.comment:
Whether to close on enter even for string non matching options.

Defaults to false.

inputs.name: componentRenderer
inputs.deprecatedMessage: Use factoryRenderer instead as it is tree shakeable.

inputs.name: constrainToViewport
inputs.comment:
Whether to clamp the popup position so that it never goes offscreen.

Defaults to false.

inputs.name: disabled
inputs.comment: Whether this input is disabled.

inputs.name: displayBottomPanel
inputs.comment: Whether to display error, hint text, and character counter panel.

inputs.name: emptyPlaceholder
inputs.comment: Text to show if the options list is empty and not loading.

inputs.name: enforceSpaceConstraints
inputs.comment:
Whether the popup should automatically reposition itself based on space available relative to the viewport.

Defaults to true.

inputs.name: error
inputs.comment:
Error to be displayed.

Higher precedent than all other errors which may be on this input.

inputs.name: factoryRenderer
inputs.comment: FactoryRenderer used to display the item.

inputs.name: filterSuggestions
inputs.comment:
Allow filtering of suggestions as the user is typing.

When false always show the full list of suggestions. Defaults to true.

inputs.name: floatingLabel
inputs.comment:
Whether or not the label "floats".

If false, the label disappears when text is entered into the box. If true, it instead "floats" up above the input.

inputs.name: hideCheckbox
inputs.comment:
Whether to hide the checkbox before the selection item for multi-select.

Defaults to false.

inputs.name: highlightMatchFromStartOfWord
inputs.comment: Whether matches should only highlight at the start of words.

inputs.name: highlightOptions
inputs.comment: Whether to highlight options. Default value is true.

inputs.name: hintText
inputs.comment:
The hint to be shown on the input.

This text will not be displayed if there is an error message on the input.

inputs.name: inputAutocomplete
inputs.comment:
The autocomplete attribute for the inner input element.

Defines the type of autocomplete functionality for the input. For example, can be on or `off``..

Note: Setting this field may depend on the browser implementation and is not guaranteed to turn off the autocomplete functionality.

inputs.name: inputText
inputs.comment:
The text the input should have.

Consider using the angular_forms NgModel instead.

inputs.name: itemRenderer
inputs.comment: A simple function to render the an item to string.

inputs.name: label
inputs.comment: The label to use on the input.

inputs.name: labelFactory
inputs.comment: Custom factory for rendering suggestion labels.

inputs.name: leadingGlyph
inputs.comment: Any persistent glyph to show before the input box.

inputs.name: leadingText
inputs.comment: Any text to show at the leading edge of the input -- e.g. a currency symbol or similar.

inputs.name: limit
inputs.comment:
How many suggestions to show.

If the limit is less than 1, it is assumed to be mean no limit. See filter method in Filterable. Defaults to 10.

inputs.name: loading
inputs.comment: When turned on and no suggestions available, show loading indicator in the suggestions dropdown.

inputs.name: maxCount
inputs.comment:
Maximum allowed characters for character counting input box.

Character count always is displayed when the value is non-null.

inputs.name: optionHighlighter
inputs.comment:
Function which returns a list of HighlightedTextSegment for the given query and value.

If no optionHighlighter is provided, a TextHighlighter is used in conjunction with the itemRenderer to produce the list of text segments.

inputs.name: optionsInput
inputs.comment:
Sets the available options for the selection component.

Accepts either a SelectionOptions or a List. If a List is passed, the StringSelectionOptions class will be used to create the selection options.

inputs.name: popupMatchInputWidth
inputs.comment:
Whether or not the suggestion popup width is at least as wide as the input width.

Defaults to false.

inputs.name: popupPositions
inputs.comment:
List of positions to try and draw the suggest popup.

See MaterialPopupComponent for more information.

inputs.name: popupShadowCssClass
inputs.comment: A custom CSS class for suggestion popup contents.

inputs.name: required
inputs.comment:
Whether or not the input is required.

If there's no input text, a required input will show a validation error when it's first blurred.

inputs.name: requiredErrorMsg
inputs.comment: Custom error message to show when the field is required and blank.

inputs.name: rightAlign
inputs.comment:
Whether the input contents should be always right aligned.

Default value is false.

inputs.name: selectionInput
inputs.comment:
Sets the selected value or selection model for the selection component.

Accepts either a SelectionModel, a selected value or null.

inputs.name: shouldClearInputOnSelection
inputs.comment:
Whether to clear the input text once the item is selected from the menu.

Defaults to false.

inputs.name: shouldClearSelectionOnInput
inputs.comment:
Whether to clear the selected value from the selection model when the input text changes.

Defaults to true.

inputs.name: showClearIcon
inputs.comment:
Show or hide the trailing close icon.

Clicking on the icon clears the input text and hides the popup. Defaults to false.

inputs.name: showHintOnlyOnFocus
inputs.comment:
Whether or not the hint text will be displayed when the input is not focused.

Defaults to false.

inputs.name: showPopup
inputs.comment: Used to control the visibility of the suggestion popup.

inputs.name: slide
inputs.comment:
Direction of popup scaling.

Valid values are x, y, or null.

inputs.name: trailingGlyph
inputs.comment: Any persistent glyph to show at the end of the input box.

inputs.name: trailingText
inputs.comment: Any text to show at the trailing edge of the input -- e.g. a currency symbol or similar.

outputs.name: onBlur
outputs.comment:
Fired when this component loses focus.

This stream is fired when:

  1. the underlying material input blurs, if there is no popup and there are subscribers to the blur stream
  2. the suggestions popup closes and there is no focus on the underlying material input

outputs.name: onClear
outputs.comment: Fired when the close icon is clicked.

outputs.name: onFocus
outputs.comment: Fired when the input gains focus.

outputs.name: onInputBlur
outputs.comment: Fired when the nested MaterialInputComponent fires a blur event.

outputs.name: selectionChange
outputs.comment:
Emits the selected value(s) whenever selection changes.

For single select, it will either be the selected value or null. For multi select, it will a list of selected values or an empty list.

outputs.name: showPopupChange
outputs.comment: Publishes event when the showPopup changes.

outputs.name: textChanged
outputs.comment: Publishes events when input text changes (on keypress.)

docs.name: MaterialNumberValueAccessor
docs.comment:
ControlValueAccessor which will coerce an input into a num.

Use materialNumberInputDirectives to get a set of directives to use with the input to provide validations. Such as the default to ensure it is a number, checkInteger, checkPositive, checkNonNegative (allows 0,) lowerBound, and upperBound.

keypressUpdate attribute has the value update on every keypress while the default is the value only updating on a blur event. blurFormat attribute causes the input to be formatted on blur events.

docs.name: MaterialPercentInputDirective
docs.comment: Directive to control material-input to accept percentage values.

inputs.name: percentErrorRenderer
inputs.comment: Function that allows clients to use their own error messages instead of the default.

docs.name: material_auto_suggest_input
docs.contents:
Overview

Most selection widgets care about two data points: what is selectable and what is selected.

In ACX selection widgets, what is selectable is represented by the SelectionOptions interface, while what is selected is represented by the SelectionModel interface.

Material Auto Suggest Input is an input field which provides suggestions to auto-complete the input as the user types. It uses these two interfaces via the selectionOptions and selection inputs, but additionally it has inputText which presents the text the user has entered.

Which input combinations to use for Material Auto Suggest Input depends on your use case.

If you are using the component to accept user entered content, and the list of options is used to assist content entry, you want to use selectionOptions and inputText. Together with the inputTextChange output, you can setup two-way binding for the input text.

HTML:

<material-auto-suggest-input
    [selectionOptions]="myOptions"
    [(inputText)]="myInput"
    ...>
</material-auto-suggest-input>

Dart:

class MyView {
  final myOptions = ['Foo', 'Bar', 'Baz'];
  String myInput = 'Bar';
}

If you are using the component to select one or more items from a list of options, and the input is used for filtering, you want to use selectionOptions and selection. Together with the selectionChange output, you can setup two-way binding for the selected value.

HTML:

<material-auto-suggest-input
    [selectionOptions]="myOptions"
    [(selection)]="mySelection"
    ...>
</material-auto-suggest-input>

Dart:

class MyView {
  final myOptions = [1, 2, 3];
  int mySelection = 2;
}

The selectionOptions input

The selectionOptions input accepts either a SelectionOptions class or a generic List.

If a List is passed, a StringSelectionOptions will be created with the list and the ItemRenderer if specified to support basic filtering.

If you need more advanced features, like grouped options, custom filtering or async search, you could also pass an implementation of SelectionOptions.

The selection input & output

The selection input accepts either a SelectionModel, a selected value or null.

By default Material Auto Suggest Input uses SingleSelectionModel. If a selected value is passed to the selection input, this value will be selected by the default selection model. If a null value is passed to the input, the default selection model will clear the selection.

If you need to use a MultiSelectionModel or a custom implementation of SelectionModel, you could also use the same input.

The selectionChange output emits the selected value(s) whenever selection changes. For single select, it will either be the selected value or null. For multi select, it will a list of selected values or an empty list.

For simpler single select use cases, you can use the [(selection)] syntax to setup two-way binding for your selected value.

docs.name: MaterialAutoSuggestInputComponent
docs.comment: See material_auto_suggest_input.md for an overview of the component. See examples for usage.

inputs.name: accessibleItemActivation
inputs.comment:
Whether suggestions should be smartly activated / highlighted.

Defaults to true.

When true:

  • If selection has selected values, the first selected value in options is activated / highlighted when the suggestions list opens. Justification - "If one or more options are selected before the listbox receives focus, focus is set on the first option in the list that is selected". https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices/#Listbox

  • If selection is empty, the first value in options is activated / highlighted when the suggestions list opens. Justification - "If none of the options are selected before the listbox receives focus, focus is set on the first option...". https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices/#Listbox

  • If selection is a MultiSelectionModel, deactivate any active suggestions when the search text changes. This does not apply for any text changes caused by shouldClearInputOnSelection or when the suggestions list opens. Justification - The W3 listbox spec (see above for link) says that "changes the selection state of the focused option" for multi-select listboxes. This means that a user cannot type a space into the textbox with an option focused, the space would be captured and used to toggle selection instead of typing a space. Clearing "focus" (deactivating) on any option makes it easy for the user to type a space into the textbox.

When false:

  • if selection isSingleSelect, don't auto activate / highlight any options.

  • if selection isMultiSelect, activate / highlight the first value when the suggestions list opens. Also, do not clear the active item when the search text changes.

inputs.name: ariaLabel
inputs.comment:
The label to use for assistive technology.

If not provided, uses the label instead.

inputs.name: characterCounter
inputs.comment:
A custom character counter function.

Takes in the input text; returns how many characters the text should be considered as.

inputs.name: clearIconTooltip
inputs.comment: Tooltip shown on clear icon.

inputs.name: closeOnActivate
inputs.comment:
Whether to cause dropdown to be closed on activation.

Defaults to true.

inputs.name: closeOnEnter
inputs.comment:
Whether to close on enter even for string non matching options.

Defaults to false.

inputs.name: componentRenderer
inputs.deprecatedMessage: Use factoryRenderer instead as it is tree shakeable.

inputs.name: constrainToViewport
inputs.comment:
Whether to clamp the popup position so that it never goes offscreen.

Defaults to false.

inputs.name: disabled
inputs.comment: Whether this input is disabled.

inputs.name: displayBottomPanel
inputs.comment: Whether to display error, hint text, and character counter panel.

inputs.name: emptyPlaceholder
inputs.comment: Text to show if the options list is empty and not loading.

inputs.name: enforceSpaceConstraints
inputs.comment:
Whether the popup should automatically reposition itself based on space available relative to the viewport.

Defaults to true.

inputs.name: error
inputs.comment:
Error to be displayed.

Higher precedent than all other errors which may be on this input.

inputs.name: factoryRenderer
inputs.comment: FactoryRenderer used to display the item.

inputs.name: filterSuggestions
inputs.comment:
Allow filtering of suggestions as the user is typing.

When false always show the full list of suggestions. Defaults to true.

inputs.name: floatingLabel
inputs.comment:
Whether or not the label "floats".

If false, the label disappears when text is entered into the box. If true, it instead "floats" up above the input.

inputs.name: hideCheckbox
inputs.comment:
Whether to hide the checkbox before the selection item for multi-select.

Defaults to false.

inputs.name: highlightMatchFromStartOfWord
inputs.comment: Whether matches should only highlight at the start of words.

inputs.name: highlightOptions
inputs.comment: Whether to highlight options. Default value is true.

inputs.name: hintText
inputs.comment:
The hint to be shown on the input.

This text will not be displayed if there is an error message on the input.

inputs.name: inputAutocomplete
inputs.comment:
The autocomplete attribute for the inner input element.

Defines the type of autocomplete functionality for the input. For example, can be on or `off``..

Note: Setting this field may depend on the browser implementation and is not guaranteed to turn off the autocomplete functionality.

inputs.name: inputText
inputs.comment:
The text the input should have.

Consider using the angular_forms NgModel instead.

inputs.name: itemRenderer
inputs.comment: A simple function to render the an item to string.

inputs.name: label
inputs.comment: The label to use on the input.

inputs.name: labelFactory
inputs.comment: Custom factory for rendering suggestion labels.

inputs.name: leadingGlyph
inputs.comment: Any persistent glyph to show before the input box.

inputs.name: leadingText
inputs.comment: Any text to show at the leading edge of the input -- e.g. a currency symbol or similar.

inputs.name: limit
inputs.comment:
How many suggestions to show.

If the limit is less than 1, it is assumed to be mean no limit. See filter method in Filterable. Defaults to 10.

inputs.name: loading
inputs.comment: When turned on and no suggestions available, show loading indicator in the suggestions dropdown.

inputs.name: maxCount
inputs.comment:
Maximum allowed characters for character counting input box.

Character count always is displayed when the value is non-null.

inputs.name: optionHighlighter
inputs.comment:
Function which returns a list of HighlightedTextSegment for the given query and value.

If no optionHighlighter is provided, a TextHighlighter is used in conjunction with the itemRenderer to produce the list of text segments.

inputs.name: optionsInput
inputs.comment:
Sets the available options for the selection component.

Accepts either a SelectionOptions or a List. If a List is passed, the StringSelectionOptions class will be used to create the selection options.

inputs.name: popupMatchInputWidth
inputs.comment:
Whether or not the suggestion popup width is at least as wide as the input width.

Defaults to false.

inputs.name: popupPositions
inputs.comment:
List of positions to try and draw the suggest popup.

See MaterialPopupComponent for more information.

inputs.name: popupShadowCssClass
inputs.comment: A custom CSS class for suggestion popup contents.

inputs.name: required
inputs.comment:
Whether or not the input is required.

If there's no input text, a required input will show a validation error when it's first blurred.

inputs.name: requiredErrorMsg
inputs.comment: Custom error message to show when the field is required and blank.

inputs.name: rightAlign
inputs.comment:
Whether the input contents should be always right aligned.

Default value is false.

inputs.name: selectionInput
inputs.comment:
Sets the selected value or selection model for the selection component.

Accepts either a SelectionModel, a selected value or null.

inputs.name: shouldClearInputOnSelection
inputs.comment:
Whether to clear the input text once the item is selected from the menu.

Defaults to false.

inputs.name: shouldClearSelectionOnInput
inputs.comment:
Whether to clear the selected value from the selection model when the input text changes.

Defaults to true.

inputs.name: showClearIcon
inputs.comment:
Show or hide the trailing close icon.

Clicking on the icon clears the input text and hides the popup. Defaults to false.

inputs.name: showHintOnlyOnFocus
inputs.comment:
Whether or not the hint text will be displayed when the input is not focused.

Defaults to false.

inputs.name: showPopup
inputs.comment: Used to control the visibility of the suggestion popup.

inputs.name: slide
inputs.comment:
Direction of popup scaling.

Valid values are x, y, or null.

inputs.name: trailingGlyph
inputs.comment: Any persistent glyph to show at the end of the input box.

inputs.name: trailingText
inputs.comment: Any text to show at the trailing edge of the input -- e.g. a currency symbol or similar.

outputs.name: onBlur
outputs.comment:
Fired when this component loses focus.

This stream is fired when:

  1. the underlying material input blurs, if there is no popup and there are subscribers to the blur stream
  2. the suggestions popup closes and there is no focus on the underlying material input

outputs.name: onClear
outputs.comment: Fired when the close icon is clicked.

outputs.name: onFocus
outputs.comment: Fired when the input gains focus.

outputs.name: onInputBlur
outputs.comment: Fired when the nested MaterialInputComponent fires a blur event.

outputs.name: selectionChange
outputs.comment:
Emits the selected value(s) whenever selection changes.

For single select, it will either be the selected value or null. For multi select, it will a list of selected values or an empty list.

outputs.name: showPopupChange
outputs.comment: Publishes event when the showPopup changes.

outputs.name: textChanged
outputs.comment: Publishes events when input text changes (on keypress.)
